meanings.sent1: She consigns the package to the courier for delivery.
meanings.sent2: He consigns the keys to the new owner of the house.
meanings.sent3: The magician consigns the rabbit into the hat for a disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The captain consigns the treasure map to the depths of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The teacher consigns the homework assignment to the students with a smile.

meanings.sent1: The manager consigns the task to the most capable team member.
meanings.sent2: She consigns herself to the fact that some things are beyond her control.
meanings.sent3: The detective consigns the suspect to a life of crime-solving.
meanings.sent4: The artist consigns his emotions to the canvas through his paintings.
meanings.sent5: The coach consigns the team's success to their hard work and dedication.

meanings.definition: To send or transfer for sale or disposal
meanings.sent1: The company consigns the products to various retailers for sale.
meanings.sent2: He consigns the old furniture to the thrift store for disposal.
meanings.sent3: The chef consigns the leftover food to the compost bin for disposal.
meanings.sent4: The farmer consigns the harvest to the market for sale.
meanings.sent5: The author consigns the unsold books to the bargain bin for sale.
